This post is a part of a series that will go deep on How to design, run and get buy-in for hackdays.

The best hackdays are the ones with a diverse group of people in a room, that’s where you get the most value. By challenging intelligent people to solve a problem across disciplines forces them to come up with new ways of thinking. See my post on choosing the right people for your hackday.

Must get these people

The people closest to you on your stakeholder blueprint.

  • your immediate team
  • users
  • stakeholders
  • experts — you can’t always get a full day of their time as they may not be a part of your organisation. Ask them to prepare a 10 minute recording of an area of their knowledge.
